opihiexarata.photometry.solution moduleÔÉÅ

The general photometric solver.

class opihiexarata.photometry.solution.PhotometricSolution(fits_filename: str, solver_engine: opihiexarata.library.engine.PhotometryEngine, astrometrics: opihiexarata.astrometry.solution.AstrometricSolution, exposure_time: Optional[float] = None, filter_name: Optional[str] = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

The primary class describing an photometric solution, based on an image provided and catalog data provided from the photometric engine.

This class is the middlewere class between the engines which solve the photometry, and the rest of the OpihiExarata code.

_original_filenameÔÉÅ

The original filename where the fits file is stored at, or copied to.

Type

string

_original_headerÔÉÅ

The original header of the fits file that was pulled to solve for this astrometric solution.

Type

Header

_original_dataÔÉÅ

The original data of the fits file that was pulled to solve for this photometric solution.

Type

array-like

astrometricsÔÉÅ

The astrometric solution that is required for the photometric solution.

Type

AstrometricSolution

sky_countsÔÉÅ

The average sky contribution per pixel.

Type

float

star_tableÔÉÅ

A table of stars around the image with their RA, DEC, and filter magnitudes. It is not guaranteed that this star table and the astrometric star table is correlated.

Type

Table

intersection_star_tableÔÉÅ

A table of stars with both the astrometric and photometric RA and DEC coordinates found by the astrometric solution and the photometric engine. The filter magnitudes of these stars are also provided. It is gauranteed that the stars within this table are correlated.

Type

Table

exposure_timeÔÉÅ

How long, in seconds, the image in question was exposed for.

Type

float

filter_nameÔÉÅ

A single character string describing the name of the filter band that this image was taken in. Currently, it assumes the MKO/SDSS visual filters.

Type

string

zero_pointÔÉÅ

The zero point of the image.

Type

float

zero_point_errorÔÉÅ

The standard deviation of the error point mean as calculated using many stars.

Type

float

__init__(fits_filename: str, solver_engine: opihiexarata.library.engine.PhotometryEngine, astrometrics: opihiexarata.astrometry.solution.AstrometricSolution, exposure_time: Optional[float] = None, filter_name: Optional[str] = None) → None[source]ÔÉÅ

Initialization of the photometric solution.

Parameters

  • fits_filename (string) ‚Äì The path of the fits file that contains the data for the astrometric solution.

  • solver_engine (PhotometryEngine subclass) ‚Äì The photometric solver engine class. This is what will act as the ‚Äúbehind the scenes‚Äù and solve the field, using this middlewhere to translate it into something that is easier.

  • astrometrics (AstrometricSolution, default = None) ‚Äì A precomputed astrometric solution which belongs to this image.

  • exposure_time (float, default = None) ‚Äì How long, in seconds, the image in question was exposed for. If not provided, calculation of the zero-point is skipped.

  • filter_name (string, default = None) ‚Äì A single character string describing the name of the filter band that this image was taken in. Currently, it assumes the MKO/SDSS visual filters. If it is None, calculation of the zero-point is skipped.

Returns

Return type

None

_calculate_star_photon_counts_coordinate(ra: float, dec: float, radius: float) → float[source]ÔÉÅ

Calculate the total number of photometric counts at an RA DEC. The counts are already corrected for the sky counts.

This function does not check if a star is actually there. This function is a wrapper around its pixel version, converting via the WCS solution.

Parameters

  • ra (float) ‚Äì The right ascension in degrees.

  • dec (float) ‚Äì The declination in degrees.

  • radius (float) ‚Äì The radius of the circular aperture to be considered, in degrees.

Returns

photon_counts ‚Äì The sum of the sky corrected counts for the region defined.

Return type

float

_calculate_star_photon_counts_pixel(pixel_x: int, pixel_y: int, radius: float) → float[source]ÔÉÅ

Calculate the total number of photometric counts at a pixel location. The counts are already corrected for the sky counts.

This function does not check if a star is actually there.

Parameters

  • pixel_x (int) ‚Äì The x cordinate of the center pixel.

  • pixel_y (int) ‚Äì The y cordinate of the center pixel.

  • radius (float) ‚Äì The radius of the circular aperture to be considered in pixel counts.

Returns

photon_counts ‚Äì The sum of the sky corrected counts for the region defined.

Return type

float

_calculate_zero_point(exposure_time: float, filter_name: Optional[str] = None) → float[source]ÔÉÅ

This function calculates the photometric zero-point of the image provided the data in the intersection star table.

This function uses the set exposure time and the intersection star table. The band is also assumed from the initial parameters.

Parameters

  • exposure_time (float) ‚Äì How long, in seconds, the image in question was exposed for.

  • filter_name (string, default = None) ‚Äì A single character string describing the name of the filter band that this image was taken in. Currently, it assumes the MKO/SDSS visual filters. If it is None, then this function does nothing.

Returns

  • zero_point (float) ‚Äì The zero point of this image. This is computed as a mean of all of the calculated zero points.

  • zero_point_error (float) ‚Äì The standard deviation of the zero points calculated.

opihiexarata.photometry.solution._vehicle_panstarrs_mast_web_api(ra: float, dec: float, radius: float) → astropy.table.table.Table[source]ÔÉÅ

A vehicle function for photometric solutions. Extract photometric data using the PanSTARRS database accessed via the MAST API.

Parameters

  • ra (float) ‚Äì The right accension of the center of the area to extract from, in degrees.

  • dec (float) ‚Äì The declination of the center of the area to extract from, in degrees.

  • radius (float) ‚Äì The search radius from the center that defines the search area.

  • Retruns ‚Äì

  • ------- ‚Äì

  • photo_star_table (Table) ‚Äì The photometric star table as found from the query.
